8305136_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Therapeutic bronchoscopy for id[REDACTED] subglottic stenosis.
HISTORY: 50-year-old female with recurrent iSGS presenting with stridor.
TECHNIQUE: General anesthesia was administered. Direct visualization revealed a mature cicatricial stricture immediately subglottic with 71% compromise. A Hurricane balloon was employed for serial dilations reaching 15mm. Each inflation was held for 90 seconds. Post-dilation, the airway patency was estimated at 68% of normal. Minimal mucosal bleeding was noted and was self-limited.
